CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 6, 1945, pg. 22 reads: "GI And Bride - The Marriage of Miss Ernestine Wilkes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Willie Wilkes of Terrace Village, and Pfc. Edward Wright, who has just returned from thirty-six months' duty in European theatre of operations, took place last week at the home of the bride. The Rev. James H. Robinson of Macedonia Baptist Church officiated.  The maid of honor was Miss Georgia Wilkes, sister of the bride.  The bride's father was best man.  After the wedding, a reception of one-hundred guests took place at Addison Hall, after which the couple left for New York on their wedding trip. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Full length group portrait of bride Ernestine Wilkes Wright wearing light colored gown with tulle overlay, sweetheart neckline, and sheer sleeves, and groom Pfc. Edward Wright wearing U.S. military uniform, posed in home of Mr. and Mrs. Willie Wilkes
